dialogues.speaker: WATERFRONT WHARVES
dialogues.text: The Assistants sit on a big packing crate, brushing soot their suits, shaking dust out of their hair, fiddling wit the rips in their jackets and trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go back to the office. Explain ourselves to the Chief Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd drive us away.  That Kafka's made things very hot for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand he was wounded in the lung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sulky) It doesn't matter.  It's too late for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at O.) What's to become of us now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at L.) Amerika.  That's the place to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ludwig jumps off the box and gapes at Oskar, tremendously impressed by this brainstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in Amerika has a toaster in their building!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oskar jumps down from the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's the place for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, linking arms, they do a strange dance along the quay
